intro: Triumfetta bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
